name: KeyManagementServiceClient
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient
description:
Google Cloud Key Management Service

Manages cryptographic keys and operations using those keys. Implements a REST model with the following objects:

  • KeyRing
  • CryptoKey
  • CryptoKeyVersion

methods.name: key_ring_path
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient.key_ring_path
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified key_ring resource name string.

params.name: credentials
params.description: Provides the means for authenticating requests made by the client. This parameter can be many types. A Google::Auth::Credentials uses a the properties of its represented keyfile for authenticating requests made by this client. A String will be treated as the path to the keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A Hash will be treated as the contents of a keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A GRPC::Core::Channel will be used to make calls through. A GRPC::Core::ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client. The channel credentials should already be composed with a GRPC::Core::CallCredentials object. A Proc will be used as an updater_proc for the Grpc channel. The proc transforms the metadata for requests, generally, to give OAuth credentials.

params.name: scopes
params.description:
The OAuth scopes for this service. This parameter is ignored if
an updater_proc is supplied.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

params.name: metadata
params.description: Default metadata to be sent with each request. This can be overridden on a per call basis.

params.name: exception_transformer
params.description:
An optional proc that intercepts any exceptions raised during an API call to inject
custom error handling.

methods.name: list_key_rings
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient#list_key_rings
methods.description: Lists KeyRings.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/kms"

key_management_service_client = Google::Cloud::Kms.new(version: :V1)
formatted_parent = Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementServiceClient.location_path("[PROJECT]", "[LOCATION]")

# Iterate over all results.
key_management_service_client.list_key_rings(formatted_parent).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
key_management_service_client.list_key_rings(formatted_parent).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: parent
params.description: Required. The resource name of the location associated with the KeyRings, in the format +projects//locations/+.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyRing instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

methods.name: create_key_ring
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient#create_key_ring
methods.description: Create a new KeyRing in a given Project and Location.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/kms"

key_management_service_client = Google::Cloud::Kms.new(version: :V1)
formatted_parent = Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementServiceClient.location_path("[PROJECT]", "[LOCATION]")

# TODO: Initialize +key_ring_id+:
key_ring_id = ''

# TODO: Initialize +key_ring+:
key_ring = {}
response = key_management_service_client.create_key_ring(formatted_parent, key_ring_id, key_ring)

params.name: parent
params.description: Required. The resource name of the location associated with the KeyRings, in the format +projects//locations/+.

params.name: key_ring_id
params.description:
Required. It must be unique within a location and match the regular
expression +[a-zA-Z0-9_-]1,63+

params.name: key_ring
params.description: A KeyRing with initial field values. A hash of the same form as Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyRing can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: create_crypto_key
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient#create_crypto_key
methods.description:
Create a new CryptoKey within a KeyRing.

Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKey#purpose is required.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/kms"

key_management_service_client = Google::Cloud::Kms.new(version: :V1)
formatted_parent = Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementServiceClient.key_ring_path("[PROJECT]", "[LOCATION]", "[KEY_RING]")
crypto_key_id = "my-app-key"
purpose = :ENCRYPT_DECRYPT
seconds = 2147483647
next_rotation_time = { seconds: seconds }
seconds_2 = 604800
rotation_period = { seconds: seconds_2 }
crypto_key = {
  purpose: purpose,
  next_rotation_time: next_rotation_time,
  rotation_period: rotation_period
}
response = key_management_service_client.create_crypto_key(formatted_parent, crypto_key_id, crypto_key)

params.name: parent
params.description: Required. The Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyRing#name of the KeyRing associated with the CryptoKeys.

params.name: crypto_key_id
params.description:
Required. It must be unique within a KeyRing and match the regular
expression +[a-zA-Z0-9_-]1,63+

params.name: crypto_key
params.description: A CryptoKey with initial field values. A hash of the same form as Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKey can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient#create_crypto_key_version
methods.description:
Create a new CryptoKeyVersion in a CryptoKey.

The server will assign the next sequential id. If unset, Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKeyVersion#state will be set to ENABLED.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/kms"

key_management_service_client = Google::Cloud::Kms.new(version: :V1)
formatted_parent = Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementServiceClient.crypto_key_path("[PROJECT]", "[LOCATION]", "[KEY_RING]", "[CRYPTO_KEY]")

# TODO: Initialize +crypto_key_version+:
crypto_key_version = {}
response = key_management_service_client.create_crypto_key_version(formatted_parent, crypto_key_version)

params.name: parent
params.description: Required. The Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKey#name of the CryptoKey associated with the CryptoKeyVersions.

params.name: crypto_key_version
params.description: A CryptoKeyVersion with initial field values. A hash of the same form as Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKeyVersion can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: update_crypto_key_version
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient#update_crypto_key_version
methods.description:
Update a CryptoKeyVersionâ€™s metadata.

Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKeyVersion#state may be changed between ENABLED and DISABLED using this method. See Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementService::DestroyCryptoKeyVersion and Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementService::RestoreCryptoKeyVersion to move between other states.

examples.code:

# TODO: Initialize +crypto_key_version+:

# TODO: Initialize +update_mask+:
update_mask = {}
response = key_management_service_client.update_crypto_key_version(crypto_key_version, update_mask)

methods.name: encrypt
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient#encrypt
methods.description: Encrypts data, so that it can only be recovered by a call to Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementService::Decrypt.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/kms"

key_management_service_client = Google::Cloud::Kms.new(version: :V1)
formatted_name = Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementServiceClient.crypto_key_path_path("[PROJECT]", "[LOCATION]", "[KEY_RING]", "[CRYPTO_KEY_PATH]")

# TODO: Initialize +plaintext+:
plaintext = ''
response = key_management_service_client.encrypt(formatted_name, plaintext)

params.name: name
params.description:
Required. The resource name of the CryptoKey or CryptoKeyVersion to use for encryption.

If a CryptoKey is specified, the server will use its Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKey#primary.

params.name: plaintext
params.description: Required. The data to encrypt. Must be no larger than 64KiB.

params.name: additional_authenticated_data
params.description:
Optional data that, if specified, must also be provided during decryption
through Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::DecryptRequest#additional_authenticated_data.  Must be no
larger than 64KiB.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: decrypt
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient#decrypt
methods.description: Decrypts data that was protected by Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementService::Encrypt.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/kms"

key_management_service_client = Google::Cloud::Kms.new(version: :V1)
formatted_name = Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementServiceClient.crypto_key_path("[PROJECT]", "[LOCATION]", "[KEY_RING]", "[CRYPTO_KEY]")

# TODO: Initialize +ciphertext+:
ciphertext = ''
response = key_management_service_client.decrypt(formatted_name, ciphertext)

params.name: name
params.description: Required. The resource name of the CryptoKey to use for decryption. The server will choose the appropriate version.

params.name: ciphertext
params.description:
Required. The encrypted data originally returned in
Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::EncryptResponse#ciphertext.

params.name: additional_authenticated_data
params.description:
Optional data that must match the data originally supplied in
Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::EncryptRequest#additional_authenticated_data.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: destroy_crypto_key_version
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient#destroy_crypto_key_version
methods.description:
Schedule a CryptoKeyVersion for destruction.

Upon calling this method, Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKeyVersion#state will be set to DESTROY_SCHEDULED and Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKeyVersion#destroy_time will be set to a time 24 hours in the future, at which point the Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKeyVersion#state will be changed to DESTROYED, and the key material will be irrevocably destroyed.

Before the Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKeyVersion#destroy_time is reached, Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementService::RestoreCryptoKeyVersion may be called to reverse the process.

params.name: name
params.description: The resource name of the CryptoKeyVersion to destroy.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

methods.name: restore_crypto_key_version
title: Google
Cloud
Kms
V1
KeyManagementServiceClient#restore_crypto_key_version
methods.description:
Restore a CryptoKeyVersion in the DESTROY_SCHEDULED, state.

Upon restoration of the CryptoKeyVersion, Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKeyVersion#state will be set to DISABLED, and Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::CryptoKeyVersion#destroy_time will be cleared.

params.name: name
params.description: The resource name of the CryptoKeyVersion to restore.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation

KeyManagementServiceClient#set_iam_policy
methods.description: Sets the access control policy on the specified resource. Replaces any existing policy.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/kms"

key_management_service_client = Google::Cloud::Kms.new(version: :V1)
formatted_resource = Google::Cloud::Kms::V1::KeyManagementServiceClient.key_ring_path("[PROJECT]", "[LOCATION]", "[KEY_RING]")

# TODO: Initialize +policy+:
policy = {}
response = key_management_service_client.set_iam_policy(formatted_resource, policy)

params.name: resource
params.description:
REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being specified.
+resource+ is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project
resource is specified as +projects/project+.

params.name: policy
params.description: REQUIRED: The complete policy to be applied to the +resource+. The size of the policy is limited to a few 10s of KB. An empty policy is a valid policy but certain Cloud Platform services (such as Projects) might reject them. A hash of the same form as Google::Iam::V1::Policy can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

params.name: yield
params.description: Access the result along with the RPC operation
